===JQuery UI Dialog as Wicket behavior example===

*[http://jqueryui.com/demos/dialog/ Original javascript version can be found here]*

*Prerequisites:* Your wicket application is configured to use JQWicket as described in the [http://code.google.com/p/jqwicket "Quick Start"] guide. Additionaly to the jquery core library you have to add "jquery ui" to the JQWicket's config.

*Description:* This example demonstrates how to integrate JQuery UI Dialog with the wicket components using JQWicket.

*Java-Code:*
{{{
public class DialogPage extends WebPage {
	public DialogPage() {
		final DialogWebMarkupContainer dialog = new DialogWebMarkupContainer(
				"dialog", new DialogOptions().modal(true).resizable(false));
		add(dialog);

		add(new AjaxLink<Void>("dialog.open1") {
			@Override
			public void onClick(AjaxRequestTarget target) {
				dialog.open(target);
			}
		});

	}
}
}}}

*Html-Template:*
{{{
<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Transitional//EN"
	"http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">
<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"
	xmlns:wicket="http://wicket.apache.org/" xml:lang="en" lang="en">
<head>
<title>Dialog example</title>
</head>
<body> 
<a wicket:id="dialog.open1">open dialog</a><br/>

<div wicket:id="dialog" title="Basic dialog">
	<p>This is the default dialog which is useful for displaying information. The dialog window can be moved, resized and closed with the 'x' icon.</p>
</div>
</body>
</html>
}}}
